instruction_manual:
ğŸ“˜ Complete NAND Flash Connection Guide:
1. ğŸ”Œ Connect Pico to PC:
   - Use USB-C cable
   - Ensure drivers are installed
2. ğŸ’¡ Connect NAND Flash to Pico:
   VCC  â†’ 3V3 (3.3V power)
   GND  â†’ GND
   I/O0 â†’ GP5
   I/O1 â†’ GP6
   I/O2 â†’ GP7
   I/O3 â†’ GP8
   I/O4 â†’ GP9
   I/O5 â†’ GP10
   I/O6 â†’ GP11
   I/O7 â†’ GP12
   CLE  â†’ GP13
   ALE  â†’ GP14
   CE#  â†’ GP15
   RE#  â†’ GP16
   WE#  â†’ GP17
   R/B# â†’ GP18
   WP#  â†’ 3V3 (disable protection)
3. ğŸ”¬ Critical Details:
   - Mandatory 10 kOhm pull-up resistors on I/O0-I/O7
   - Power supply range: 3.3V Â±5%
   - Never hot-plug the chip!
4. ğŸ›  Safety Guidelines:
   âš ï¸ Always power off before handling
   âš ï¸ Use ESD wrist strap
   âš ï¸ Avoid short circuits
5. ğŸ” Troubleshooting:
   - If chip not detected:
     a) Check pinout
     b) Measure VCC voltage
     c) Test resistors with multimeter
   - Error code 0xDEAD: Reconnect chip
